iWant: it to be able to explain in easy and accessible language
soThat: everyone regardless of backgrounds can understand the outcome of the tool
because: I know how much people from different backgrounds struggle with difficult language and long and complex content
desirable:
- accessible in different languages and sign language
- "einfache Sprache" (as an option) to be expanded etc.
- multiple input and output channels
- visual representation of content should be accessible
- structured and short sentences
- screen reader proof
dealBreakers:
- only complex terms
- just a link list to other complex texts
- if it doesn't understand my natural language
- produce gibberish
comment:
- Respect and Dignity placed close to each other.
- Autonomy, Empowerment and Participation placed close to each other.
- Diversity and Accessibility placed close to each other.

values.explanation: If you cannot understand it or the output is wrong, you lose trust in it
Developing something to include access to everyone shows respect to all people
Technology might "look down" on you based on the used language
All people can self-dependently use the tool
People should be empowered that their input also matters
Everyone should be thought of as a participant
For a broad user group and so that no one feels excluded
The tool needs to be accessible for everyone
